Kassipojad magasid ahjuaugus kuiva ja sooja.
context: Magasid is the past tense plural form of the Estonian verb 'magama' which means 'to sleep'. In this context, it specifically refers to multiple beings (likely animals or children) sleeping in a warm fireplace opening. The word appears to be used poetically or descriptively to describe cozy, comfortable sleeping arrangements.
